                               The following clubs meet every other week in the Kimmel Center for University Life, Suite 602 during the academic year. Club meetings offer an opportunity for students to meet other students and to provide a safe space for LGBTQ students and their allies to explore issues and discuss hot topics. Check the calendar for a full schedule of club meetings and events!       Fluidity   For genders and sexualities that fall outside of the gay, lesbian and gender binary. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-fluidity@lists.nyu.edu   Men's Group   For gay, bisexual and transgender men and their allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-lgbt-office-mensgroup@lists.nyu.edu   Queer Grads   For LGBTQA graduate students seeking cross-department solidarity. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-queer-grads@lists.nyu.edu   Shades   For lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer students of color and allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-shades@lists.nyu.edu   T-Party   For transgender and gender non-comforming students and allies. To join the listserve, send a blank email to: join-t-party@lists.nyu.edu   All-Square Student Clubs   Queer Union   This is an All-Square Club advised by the Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service. NYU's All-University LGBT Club The second oldest college LGBT group in the country, Queer Union is an activist, social, political and educational group. It also runs the Queer Union listserve, a confidential way to get information on campus and city LGBT events and meetings. To join the listserve, send a blank email to: join-queer-union@lists.nyu.edu   CampGrrl   For self-identified lesbian, bisexual, queer and transgender women and their allies. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-campgrrl@lists.nyu.edu     Keshet   This is an All-Square Club advised by the Center for Student Activities, Leadership and Service  NYU's LGBT Jewish student group. Everyone is welcome regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. To join the listserve for meeting and event announcements, send a blank email to: join-keshet@lists.nyu.edu              School-Based Organizations          The following schools have their own LGBTQA-themed organizations. Many of them are catered specifically to graduate students, but please visit their pages for more information:     NYU School of Engineering     Law School   Wagner Graduate School of Public Service   Ehrenkranz School of Social Work   Stern School of Business - Undergraduate Students (Pride Corp)   Stern School of Business - Graduate Students (OUTClass)     School of Medicine   School of Nursing   If you represent a campus organization dedicated to the support of NYU's LGBTQ student community, and wish to have your group listed above, please email the center at LGBTQ.Student.Center@nyu.edu with your group's name and the student demographic which you support and we will happily include you above.                               Center's Hours     Monday - Thursday   |9:00 AM - 8:00 PM|   Friday   |9:00 AM - 5:00 PM|                                                    Join OUTPost The NYU LGBTQ weekly e-newsletter! Stay up-to-date on the latest LGBTQ news and events from our center, NYU and New York City. E-newsletters are sent every Friday afternoon. To sign up for OUTPost, send a blank email message to: join-outpost@lists.nyu.edu Read More                                                        NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Find an All-Square Club     All-square clubs are listed in NYU OrgSync, which maintains a directory of clubs officially sponsored by the University . OrgSync allows students to connect directly with club leaders online, and helps club leaders manage membership and budgets. All NYU students have access to OrgSync — simply use your NetID to log in and start browsing for clubs now.   For a full list of all-square clubs, click here . (NetID required)   Club Fest, which takes place at the beginning of each Fall and Spring semester, is another great way to explore clubs across the University.       Find School-Based Clubs     School clubs are student organizations that are affiliated with a particular school, college, or academic department and whose principle mission or purpose is related to the students of that school, college or academic department. Their funding comes from the school or college, their advisor is affiliated with the school or college, and the school or college governs them.   Select your school link below to find out how to get involved in clubs within your specific school.     College of Arts and Science   College of Dentistry   College of Nursing   Gallatin School of Individualized Study   Graduate School of Arts and Science   Institute of Fine Arts   Leondard N. Stern School of Business   Polytechnic School of Engineering   Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service   Silver School of Social Work     If your school is not listed above, contact their Student Life office, or reach out to your advisor.     Music Ensembles     Orchestras, choirs, and music ensembles are sponsored by NYU Steinhardt — some of which are open to NYU students from all schools and majors, as well as community members. Click here to browse a full list.       Commuter or Off-Campus Student?     NYU's Student Resource Center hosts a variety of programs for commuter and off-campus students, such as the Commuter Student Council, Commuter Assistants, and other special events.   To explore ways you can get more involved as a commuter or off-campus student, click here or visit the SRC in Kimmel 210.     Transfer Student Programs     The NYU's Student Resource Center (SRC) hosts a variety of programs for transfer and visiting students, such as the Transfer Student Association, Transfer Ambassador, Transfermation and other special programs!   Learn about all of the ways you can be involved with Transfer and Visiting student programs, click here or visit the SRC in Kimmel 210.                                            NYU Club Fest   Club Fest brings together NYU clubs under one roof for the semester's largest recruiting event. Get to know NYU clubs as members share information and answer your questions. Club Fest happens twice a year: once in the fall semester, then again at the beginning of the spring semester. Learn more »                       Visit CSALS     The Center for Student Activities, Leadership, and Service — located in Kimmel Suite 704 — provides opportunities to discover and build your on-campus community. Learn more »                       Featured Events     Various events and programs hosted by Student Affairs throughout the year provide exciting ways for students to explore campus, take advantage of New York City, meet peers, and engage with relevant issues. Learn more »                                                        NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University.
